Html Module¶

class epyk.core.html.Html.Body(report, vals, htmlCode=None, code=None, width=None, widthUnit=None, height=None, heightUnit=None, globalFilter=None, dataSrc=None, options=None, profile=None, css_attrs=None)¶
property dom¶

Javascript Functions

Return all the Javascript functions defined for an HTML Component. Those functions will use plain javascript by default.

Returns

A Javascript Dom object

Return type

JsHtml.JsHtml

onLoad(jsFncs)¶
Parameters

jsFncs –

onReady(jsFncs)¶

Add set of event / actions whihc will be triggered after the build of the object. usually this can be used to add js functions on a chart or a table

Usage:

network = rptObj.ui.charts.vis.network()
network.onReady([

network.js.setData({“nodes”: [{“id”: 0, “label”: “test”}], “edges”: []}),

])

Parameters

jsFncs – List. Javascript function to be added once the object is built

set_background(start_color=None, end_color=None, from_theme=False)¶

Change the body background color

Usage:

rptObj.body.set_background("#101626", "#374F67")
Parameters

  • start_color –

  • end_color –

set_content(report, page_content)¶

Function to allow the templating of the report. This can be overridden by a generic class which can be shared within a set of report

Parameters

  • report – Report. The main report object

  • page_content – String. The html content of the page

Returns

The Body HTML object

class epyk.core.html.Html.Html(report, vals, htmlCode=None, code=None, width=None, widthUnit=None, height=None, heightUnit=None, globalFilter=None, dataSrc=None, options=None, profile=None, css_attrs=None)¶

Parent class for all the HTML components. All the function defined here are available in the children classes. Child class can from time to time re implement the logic but the function will always get the same meaning (namely the same signature and return)

add_menu(context_menu)¶

Attach a context menu to an existing component. A context menu must have a component attached to otherwise the report will not be triggered

Parameters

context_menu – A Python context menu object

add_options(options=None, name=None, value=None)¶

Change the Javascript options of the component. This will change the options sent to the Javascript

Parameters

  • name – String. The key

  • value – String. The value

Returns

self to allow the chains

append_child(htmlObj)¶

Wrapper to the Javascript method appendChild to append an HTML component

Usage:

for i in range(10):
encore = rptObj.ui.texts.label("Add Label %s" % i).css({"width": "100%", "display": 'block'})
select.append_child(encore)

https://www.w3schools.com/jsref/met_node_appendchild.asp

Parameters

htmlObj – The html component

Returns

The htmlObj

css(key, value=None, reset=False)¶

Change the CSS Style of a main component. This is trying to mimic the signature of the Jquery css function

http://api.jquery.com/css/

Parameters

  • key – The key style in the CSS attributes (Can also be a dictionary)

  • value – The value corresponding to the key style

  • reset – Boolean

Returns

The python object itself

property dom¶

Javascript Functions

Return all the Javascript functions defined for an HTML Component. Those functions will use plain javascript by default.

Returns

A Javascript Dom object

Return type

JsHtml.JsHtml

drop(jsFncs, preventDefault=True, profile=False)¶

Add a drag and drop property to the element

Usage:

d = rptObj.ui.div()

d.drop([rptObj.js.objects.data.toRecord([1, 2, 3, 4], “result”)])

Parameters

  • jsFncs –

  • preventDefault – Boolean.

  • profile –

Returns

Return self to allow the chaining

get_attrs(withId=True, pyClassNames=None)¶

Return the string line with all the attributes

All the attributes in the div should use double quote and not simple quote to be consistent everywhere in the framework and also in the javascript. If there is an inconsistency, the aggregation of the string fragments will not work

Parameters

  • withId –

  • pyClassNames –

Returns

A string with the dom attributes

property js¶

Javascript base function

Return all the Javascript functions defined in the framework. THis is an entry point to the full Javascript ecosystem.

Returns

A Javascript object

Return type

Js.JsBase

mouse(on_fncs=None, out_fncs=None)¶

Wrapper function fot the mouse event. This function will cover the on mouse hover event and mouse out.

More specific events are possible using the generic out function

Usage:

span.mouse([
  span.dom.css("color", "red"),
  span.dom.css("cursor", "pointer").r],
  span.dom.css("color", "blue").r)
Parameters

  • on_fncs – Array or String of Javascript events

  • out_fncs – Array or String of Javascript events

Returns

self to allow the chains

move()¶

Move the component to this position in the page

on(event, jsFncs, profile=False)¶

Add an event to the document ready function. This is to mimic the Jquery on function.

https://www.w3schools.com/jquery/event_on.asp https://www.w3schools.com/js/js_htmldom_eventlistener.asp https://www.w3schools.com/jsref/dom_obj_event.asp

Parameters

  • event – A string with the Javascript event type from the dom_obj_event.asp

  • jsFncs – A Javascript Python function

  • profile – A Boolean. Set to true to get the profile for the function on the Javascript console

Returns

self to allow the chains

onReady(jsFncs)¶

Add set of event / actions whihc will be triggered after the build of the object. usually this can be used to add js functions on a chart or a table

Usage:

network = rptObj.ui.charts.vis.network()
network.onReady([

network.js.setData({“nodes”: [{“id”: 0, “label”: “test”}], “edges”: []}),

])

Parameters

jsFncs – List. Javascript function to be added once the object is built

paste(jsFnc)¶

Generic click function

prepend_child(htmlObj)¶

Wrapper to the Javascript method insertChild to add an HTML component

Usage:

for i in range(10):
encore = rptObj.ui.texts.label("Add Label %s" % i).css({"width": "100%", "display": 'block'})
select.prepend_child(encore)

https://www.w3schools.com/jsref/met_node_insertbefore.asp

Parameters

htmlObj – The html component

Returns

The htmlObj

set_attrs(attrs=None, name=None, value=None)¶

Function to update the internal dictionary of object attributes. Those attributes will be used when the HTML component will be defined. Basically all sort of attributes can be defined here: CSS attributes, but also data, name… Either the attrs or the tuple (name, value) can be used to add information to the dom object.

All the attributes should be Python object which are ready to use on the Javascript side. For example True should be written ‘true’

Tips: It is possible to use the data- attributes to store any kind of information in the dom.

Parameters

  • attrs – A python dictionary with the attributes

  • name – A python string with the name of the attribute

  • value – A python string with the value of the attribute

to_word(document)¶

Apply the corresponding function to produce the same result in a word document. This function is very specific and it has to be defined in each class.

http://python-docx.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

to_xls(workbook, worksheet, cursor)¶

Apply the corresponding function to produce the same result in a word document. This function is very specific and it has to be defined in each class.

https://xlsxwriter.readthedocs.io/

tooltip(value, location='top')¶

Add the Tooltip feature when the mouse is over the component. This tooltip version is coming from Bootstrap

Usage:

htmlObj.tooltip("My tooltip", location="bottom")

https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.1/components/tooltips/

Parameters

  • value –

  • location –

Returns

The Python object self

property val¶

Property to get the jquery value of the HTML object in a python HTML object. This method can be used in any jsFunction to get the value of a component in the browser. This method will only be used on the javascript side, so please do not consider it in your algorithm in Python

Returns

Javascript string with the function to get the current value of the component
